pullRequest.body:
feat (CategoryTheory/Topos): Add topos theory content

This code contains basic definitions and results in topos theory, including the definition of a subobject classifier, power objects, and topoi. It is proved that every topos has exponential objects, i.e. "internal homs". The mathematical content follows chapter IV sections 1-2 of Mac Lane and Moerdijk's text "Sheaves in Geometry and Logic". 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [37d41444d5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21269/commits/37d41444d545c10052ac713f9586172025c8848c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Classifier` (new file)|580|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Power` (new file)|585|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Basic` (new file)|606|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Exponentials` (new file)|608|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ClassifierComm`
`+ ClassifierCone`
`+ ClassifierCone_into`
`+ ClassifierCone_into_comm`

`+ ClassifierPb`

`+ ExpHom`
`+ ExponentialObject_inst`
`+ Exponentiates`
`+ FnName`
`+ HasClassifier`
`+ HasExponentialObject`
`+ HasExponentialObjects`
`+ HasPower`
`+ HasPowers`
`+ Hom`
`+ HomMapSquareComm`
`+ Hom_Exponentiates`
`+ Hom_Unique`
`+ Hom_comm`
`+ Hom_isExponential`
`+ Hom_map`
`+ Hom_mapCondition`
`+ Hom_map_inv`
`+ Hom_toGraph`
`+ Hom_toGraph_Mono`
`+ InternalComposition`
`+ IsClassifier`
`+ IsExponentialObject`
`+ IsPower`
`+ Mono_is_RegularMono`
`+ Name`
`+ P_transpose`
`+ P_transpose_inv`
`+ P_transpose_left_inv`
`+ P_transpose_right_inv`
`+ P_transpose_symm`
`+ P_transpose_symm_inv`
`+ P_transpose_symm_left_inv`
`+ P_transpose_symm_right_inv`
`+ Pow`
`+ PowFunctor`
`+ PowFunctorOp`
`+ PowSelfAdj`
`+ Pow_is_power`
`+ Pow_map`
`+ Pow_map_Powerizes`
`+ Pow_map_id`
`+ Pow_powerizes`
`+ Pow_unique`
`+ Predicate.NameDef`
`+ Predicate.NameEquiv`
`+ Predicate.eq`
`+ Predicate.eq_of_lift_eq`
`+ Predicate.fromName`
`+ Predicate.isSingleton`
`+ Predicate.lift_eq`
`+ Predicate.true_`
`+ TensorHomAdjunction`
`+ Topos`
`+ ToposHasExponentials`
`+ ToposMonoidal`
`+ balanced`
`+ chosenFiniteProducts`
`+ eval`
`+ evalCondition`
`+ evalDef_comm`
`+ h_map`
`+ in_`
`+ instance : Balanced C`
`+ instance : Balanced Cᵒᵖ := balanced_opposite`
`+ reflectsIsomorphisms`
`+ reflectsIsomorphismsOp`
`+ singleton`
`+ singletonMono`
`+ t`
`+ transposeEquiv`
`+ transposeEquivSymm`
`+ transpose_transpose_Equiv`
`+ truth_is_RegularMono`
`+ unique`
`+ Ω`
`+ χ_`
`++ hasBinaryProducts`
`++ hasEqualizers`
`++ hasFiniteProducts`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I am not an expert in this approach to toposes. I would suggest you start with a smaller PR with only the content of the file `Classifier.lean`. Beware that some of your definitions do not follow the naming/capitalisation conventions, see https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html
Otherwise, the results looks great.

Thank you for your feedback!

> I would suggest you start with a smaller PR with only the content of the file `Classifier.lean`. 

OK! I will retry with just the content of Classifier.lean. Once that PR gets accepted I will try again with the other content.

> Beware that some of your definitions do not follow the naming/capitalisation conventions

I have some bad habits inherited from lean3 that I haven't fully gotten rid of. I'll do my best to carefully rename before another PR.
This should be an assumption rather than an instance, because `ChosenFiniteProducts` contains data. Otherwise, when we want to apply this to sheaf categories, we shall get multiple instances.
Maybe these sections are still in progress, but my understanding is it's perfectly fine to omit these empty sub-headings.

See `Exponentiable` and `CartesianClosed` in `CategoryTheory.Closed.Cartesian`. See also `CategoryTheory.Adjunction.PartialAdjoint` if you absolutely need `HasExponentialObject` instead of `Exponentiable`.
This should also be a definition instead of an instance because some topos are "naturally" endowed with a closed monoidal structure.
